questions.question_text: Which three permissions are included for a delegated administrator? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Manage permissions sets for external users on their account.
choices.D: Manage object access for external users.
choices.C: Generate new passwords for external users.
choices.B: Add external users to multiple accounts.
choices.E: Create and edit external user records.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
Options B and D are incorrect:

Selected Answer: ACE
'Delegated administrators can:
Create and edit users in specified roles and all subordinate roles. User editing tasks include resetting passwords, setting quotas, creating default opportunity teams, and creating personal groups for those users.
Assign or remove permission sets for users in their delegated groups.' https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.admin_delegate.htm&type=5

comments.content:
Furthermore, delegate users are not able to edit profiles and permission sets (control object access). They may only assign them to an external user. 

External users only get one user account, so 'adding to other accounts' isn't a thing.

questions.question_text:
Insightopia’s Experience Cloud site went live on the first day of the last month. The launch has been very successful, and the number of community members has reached the first milestone of 10,000. The Experience Cloud site manager wants to implement gamification methods to increase engagement and adoption.

What should be the recommended approach for implementing gamification?

choices.B: Use the Einstein game mechanics feature for implementing gamification.
choices.D: Organize a community event to get ideas for implementing gamification.
choices.C: Use the Missions feature to assign badges to members automatically.
choices.A: Build flows to implement gamification for community members.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Use the Missions feature to assign badges to members automatically.

The Missions feature allows you to set specific tasks or actions within the community that members can complete to earn badges or rewards. By setting up missions aligned with desired community behaviors or goals, you can incentivize engagement and encourage members to participate more actively. This automated approach to gamification can help sustain long-term engagement and foster a sense of achievement among community members.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct here. https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=sf.networks_missions.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: To which three objects can the Partner Super User access be applied? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
Partner super user access applies only to cases, leads, custom objects, and opportunities.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.networks_partner_super_user_access.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: BC
1. **Visible in Public Knowledge Base**: This setting ensures that the Knowledge article is accessible to unauthenticated visitors to the site. When an article is marked as visible in the public knowledge base, it can be viewed by anyone who visits the site, even if they haven't logged in.

2. **Visible to Guest User**: By setting the article as visible to guest users, you allow third-party authenticated users (users who are not part of your Salesforce organization but have been authenticated through some other means, such as SSO or community login) to view the article. This ensures that users who have logged in through third-party authentication can also access the article.

By configuring both of these settings, you ensure that the Knowledge article is accessible to internal Salesforce users, unauthenticated visitors to the site, and third-party authenticated users.

comments.content:
A- Visible to Partner is not a good answer here because:
The "Visible to Partner" setting is typically used to make Knowledge articles available specifically to users within your partner community. When you mark a Knowledge article as visible to partners, it means that only users who are part of your partner community and have the appropriate access permissions will be able to view the article.

If you want to make the article accessible to unauthenticated visitors, as well as to third-party authenticated users (who may not necessarily be part of your partner community), using the "Visible to Partner" setting wouldn't be appropriate. Instead, you would use the "Visible in Public Knowledge Base" and "Visible to Guest User" settings to achieve broader visibility for the article across different types of users.

discussion.content:
AB is the correct options here.
A. Visible to Partner
B. Visible in Public Knowledge Base
Visible in Knowledge Base controls visibility to Guest Users.
